newsitem.title: USA: APAC shares down on Q1, outlook.
newsitem.headline: APAC shares down on Q1, outlook.

text.p: APAC TeleServices Inc shares fell nine at 12-1/2 at mid-day Monday after reporting first quarter earnings that were below the consensus and warning that results for 1997 will be hurt by a major contract.
"They missed their quarter," GS2 Securities analyst John Larson said.
APAC reported earnings of $0.18 a share, up from $0.10 a year ago, but below the First Call consensus of $0.20 a share.
Larson added that APAC management told a conference call they are "not uncomfortable" with a 1997 revenue estimate of $380 million, which is below the prior consensus.
Larson said he did not have an exact consensus estimate for 1997 revenues, but said he believed the Street had expected revenues for the year "a little above $400 million."
APAC's revenues for 1996 amounted to $276.4 million. It earned $30.6 million or $0.64 a share in 1996.
APAC said certain costs related to a large outsourcing client hurt first quarter results, and warned that the contract would hurt revenues, margins and earnings for the balance of 1997.
Larson said the large client is United Parcel Service of America Inc, which was later confirmed by an APAC spokesman.
Larson said the UPS contract accounted for nearly 30 percent of APAC's first-quarter revenues.
